posts.html:
Wrath of God, you shall be missed. Ever since those good ol' days in Alpha...

But as anyone else might have said, this card is better than wrath because it allows you to regenerate your creatures (Cudgel Troll or Drudge Skeletons, anyone?). Or there's Wrap In Vigor, as someone else pointed out.

@Corgi: Um, no. Protection only works against cards that specifically TARGETS that creature with protection. It doesn't work against cards that affect the entire board like this card. So sorry, even the cards that have protection from white die. Tough luck. Even Progenitus is affected.
Report Abuse

Posted By: SocialExperiment (9/26/2009 11:41:51 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I actually like this card more than [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God). I know it's not really as good, but not very many creatures get to regenerate, and when they do, they are often cards like Wrath and [Terminate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminate) that just preemptively say "no". Not having a clause about regeneration will make for more fun games and make creatures with the ability to regenerate all the better. It is good for the environment when cards have abilities that actually make a difference.  
  
And what if you have a way to only regenerate your own creatures? Like [Loxodon Hierarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Loxodon Hierarch), as was mentioned?
posts.html:

Not having a clause about regeneration will make for more fun games and make creatures with the ability to regenerate all the better. And what if you have a way to only regenerate your own creatures? Like Loxodon Hierarch, as was mentioned?

Posted By: godmetal101 (10/1/2009 5:34:38 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Or you could simply play [Brave the Elements](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brave the Elements). It costs one less than [Wrap in Vigor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrap in Vigor), and will serve the right basic function, especially if you're playing mono-white. Plus you can play it in standard. If only it were around when [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God) were standard.  
  
Or you could play [Kabira Evangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kabira Evangel) in an ally deck. Instead of limiting your colors, it limits sub-types, but that's not a problem when you've got an ally strategy going. And of course Kabira is good for keeping the nasties at bay in the meantime.
posts.html:
Or you could simply play Brave the Elements. It costs one less than Wrap in Vigor, and will serve the right basic function, especially if you're playing mono-white. Plus you can play it in standard. If only it were around when Wrath of God were standard.

Or you could play Kabira Evangel in an ally deck. Instead of limiting your colors, it limits sub-types, but that's not a problem when you've got an ally strategy going. And of course Kabira is good for keeping the nasties at bay in the meantime.
